body:
### Symphony data acquisition for .Net

Symphony is a modern physiology data acquisition framework for Windows and .Net. 

### Requirements

Symphony requires Windows 7 (32-bit) and .Net 4.0. It currently supports the following devices:

- Heka Instruments ITC18 (PCI and USB interfaces)
- Molecular Devices MultiClamp (via the MultiClamp commander software interface)

### Getting Started

Install Symphony via the Windows installer. A Matlab-based front end has been developed at the Janelia Farm Research Campus of the Howard Hughes Medical Institute (see the [Symphony-UI](https://github.com/midgleyf/Symphony-UI) project).

### Development

Symphony is a Visual Studio 2010/2012 solution. To build and run the tests, copy the DLLs in the externals\HDF5DotNet directory to the C:\Windows\System32. To build the installer, you will also need to install the [WiX](http://wixtoolset.org) installer toolset.

### Authors and Contributors
Symphony was written by @barrywark and @tedneward at Physion Consulting (@physion).

### Support or Contact
Check out the documentation on the project Wiki, or add a ticket on the project issues page. Commercial support is available from Physion (info@physionconsulting.com for more info).
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
name: Symphony
